page.title: 01The Beecroft Art Gallery
page.content: The Gallery is situated in Station Road, Westcliff-on-Sea, opposite the Cliffs Pavilion.It is 85 years old.Originally it was two houses with seven floors.Then it became The Warwick Hotel.Mr. Walter Beecroft bought it and turned it into an Art Gallery.It is now a Charitable Trust administered by Southend Council.There are 2090 paintings.It is not open every weekend as there is only one full-time member of staff to run it; but there are almost 60 volunteers helping, mainly elderly folk living nearby who love Art.There is only one part-time cleaner.It's most famous painting is-"On the Stour" by John Constable which is normally kept in a safe.There are lots of pictures of Old Southend, and many postcards and books on sale. Written by Clare Saville aged 10.
